CARDINAL . NORP In GPE the applicant had been making a living as the owner of a pizzeria until DATE . Since DATE he had been receiving welfare benefits and was at the same time assigned job training by the municipality with the possibility of continuing employment . A works at a retirement home .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and detained on remand , charged with drug trafficking allegedly committed during DATE . By judgment of DATE ORG ( retten i Hobro ) found him guilty , inter alia , of drug trafficking with regard to QUANTITY of heroine contrary to LAW . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment and , pursuant to sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , was expelled from GPE with a life - long ban on his return .

CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW , the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG claiming that material changes in his circumstances had occurred on account of which he requested the court to review the expulsion order . He referred to his family situation and alleged , with reference to information obtained from ORG , that it could not be ruled out that he would risk severe punishment in GPE for having deserted from the army and also perhaps receive a life sentence for the narcotics crimes committed in GPE .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request , as it did not find that the applicant 's situation had changed to such an extent that there was any reason to revoke the expulsion order . This decision was upheld by ORG ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant had served CARDINAL of his sentence and was due to be released on parole . Since he did not consent to the deportation and refused to leave the country voluntarily , he was detained as from that date in accordance with LAW with a view to being repatriated . Also in accordance with LAW , the applicant availed himself of the possibility , prior to the enforcement of a deportation , to bring before the immigration authorities ( ORG ) the question whether he could be returned to GPE , since , pursuant to LAW , an alien must not be returned to a country in which he or she will risk persecution on the grounds set out in LAW July DATE concerning LAW . The immigration authorities found , on DATE , that the applicant would not risk persecution in GPE of a kind which could constitute a basis for his remaining in GPE . The applicant appealed against this decision to ORG ( PERSON ) , which on DATE requested ORG to provide more information on the situation in GPE .
Having obtained information from several different authorities , on CARDINAL DATE ORG confirmed the immigration authorities ' decision .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , relying on section CARDINAL of LAW for the second time , and claiming that material changes in his circumstances had occurred , the applicant requested ORG to reconsider the expulsion decision . The court had the same material at its disposal as ORG and a number of statements from doctors concerning the applicant 's state of health . In addition , A was heard stating inter alia that her daughter from a previous relationship , refuses to move to GPE . By judgment of DATE the ORG revoked the decision to expel the applicant .

On DATE the High Court of Western Denmark quashed the above decision and dismissed the applicant 's request for reconsideration of the expulsion order since , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW , an expelled alien is entitled to CARDINAL judicial review of the question of expulsion . The applicant 's application for leave to appeal against this decision was granted by the Leave to Appeal Board ( Procesbevillingsnævnet ) on CARDINAL DATE .
The applicant was released from his detention on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision of DATE as it agreed that a request for a review of an expulsion order pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW could only be examined once by the courts .

Section CARDINAL :

CARDINAL . NORP “ In deciding whether or not to expel the alien , regard must be had not only to the alien 's ties with the NORP community , including the duration of his stay in GPE , but also to the question whether expulsion must be assumed to be particularly burdensome on him , in particular because of :
( i ) the alien 's age , health , and other circumstances ;
( ii ) the alien 's personal or family ties with NORP or foreign nationals living in GPE ;
( iii ) the alien 's other ties with GPE , including whether the alien came to GPE in his childhood or DATE and therefore spent some or all of DATE in GPE ;
( iv ) the alien 's slight or non - existent ties with his country of origin or any other country in which he may be expected to take up residence ;
( v ) the risk that the alien will be ill - treated in his country of origin or any other country in which he may be expected to take up residence ; and

( vi ) exposure to outrages , misuse or other harm etc . in the present country causing an alien holding a residence permit pursuant to section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL ( ii ) to no longer cohabit at a shared residence with the person permanently resident in GPE , or the alien 's otherwise particularly weak position .
CARDINAL . An alien may be expelled pursuant to section CARDINAL ) unless factors mentioned in subsection CARDINAL above constitute a decisive argument against doing so . ”
